Reliability (Consistency & Difficulty**:
Very low consistency. 
Just making contact.
Tactics:
No rally structure. 
Just reacts to ball.
Techniques: Forehand only, swing changes every time.

Reliability (Consistency & Difficulty**:
40–55% on easy balls. 
Difficult balls almost always errors.
Tactics:
Understands 'stay at the back' ,
but forgets under pressure.

Reliability (Consistency & Difficulty**:
60–70% on routine balls. 
Difficult balls rarely controlled.
Tactics:
Can follow rally direction. 
Understands ready position.
Techniques:
Groundstrokes repeatable. 
First good attempts at back wall.

Tactics:
Chooses when to lob/defend. 
Often use a net position.
Techniques:
First reliable volleys. 
Basic back wall defense.

Tactics:
Can build rally. 
Lob used as "win the net" tool.
Techniques:
Bandeja directional but inconsistent depth. 
Volleys maintain slow rallies.
Arsenal: + early Bandeja, early Smash, Smash x4

Tactics:
Anticipates choices sometimes. 
Resets under pressure.
Techniques:
Back wall defense works at medium pace. 
Safer bandeja.

Confident volleys. Bandeja with depth. 
Vibora appears sometimes.
Arsenal: + early Smash x3, early Gancho/Rulo, Chiqita,

Tactics:
Selects tactics based on opponent. 
Controls point pace.
Techniques:
Reliable bandeja and bajada depth. 
Controlled smash selection. Vibora became the important weapon

Uses volleys, bandeja, vibora, topspin smash by purpose. 
Land winners with high consistency.
Arsenal: alsmost every available tool in padel with many formations

Level:
* It is assumed that experience is gained while playing with opponents of roughly the same level without additional training with coach.
Also, players who come from Tennis or Squash transfer their skills to padel much faster. Other racket sports also help, but the effect is weaker and becomes less noticeable as a player progresses into higher ranked levels.
** Difficult ball is a ball with low rebund and high speed or slow ball that cought player offguard dirung high pace race
